Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Dozens of people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior, fussing with their belongings, setting up new tents, and discreetly selling wares to one another.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a 'reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)' to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.

as a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city's storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.
Document Sources.Source Justification: recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: There were 178 people on the Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing's online waitlist for shelter on Monday afternoon.
Document Sources.Name of Source: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing
Document Sources.Source Justification: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing's online waitlist
